shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) ʾOrit zä-lǝdät “Genesis” (fols. 2ra-35vc) II) ʾOrit zä-ḍäʾat “Exodus“ (fols. 36ra-67rb) III) ʾOrit zä-lewawǝyan “Leviticus” (fols. 67rc-89va) IV) ʾOrit zä-ḫwǝlqw “Numbers“ (fols. 89va-120vc) V) ʾOrit zä-dagǝm “Deuteronomy” (fols. 121ra- 149va) VI) ʾOrit zä-ʾIyasu “Joshua” (fols. 150ra-168va) VII) ʾOrit zä-mäsafǝnt “Judges” (fols. 168vb-188vb) VIII) ʾOrit zä-Rut “Ruth” (fols. 188vc-191rb)
Additiones 1-3.

txstates.txstate: The back board is broken and repaired. The headband is torn off. The textblock is loosely attached to the boards. The overback is torn and carefully amended. Some fols. are affected by humidity. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 75, 109, 174 and 175. The spine cover has been damaged and carefully repaired.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired) covered with brown blind tooled leather (quarter cover). Three pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather overback (at least 2 tools were used: double line fillet, triple line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistake: the fol. after fol. 65 was foliated as 67 (number 66 is missing).

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l. 1, stub after 1/fol. 1) – I(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 2r-11v) – II(10/fols. 12r-21v) – III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – IV(4/fols. 32r-35v) – V(10/fols. 36r-45v) – VI(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 46r-55v) – VII(10/fols. 56r-65v) – VIII(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 67r-76v) – IX(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 77r-86v) – X(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 87r-96v) – XI(10/fols. 97v-106v) – XII(10/fols. 107r-116v) – XIII(4/fols. 117r-120v) – XIV(10/fols. 121r-130v) – XV(9/s. l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 131r-139v) – XVI(10/fols. 140r-149v) – XVII(10/fols. 150r-159v) – XVIII(10/fols. 160r-169v) – XIX(10/fols. 170r-179v) – XX(10/fols. 180r-189v) – XXI(7; s.l. 2, stub after 4/fols. 190r-196v).
In quire XXI, two additional bifolios (fols. 193r-194v, 194r-195v) of different size were infixed between leaves 2 and 3 (now fols. 191 and 196 resp.).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines (1st, 3rd, 5th and occasionally 24th, 25th) in the incipit pages of Texts I-VIII; the word mǝˤǝraf, “chapter”, followed by an Ethiopic numeral; the initial line of some chapters of Texts II and III: wä-näbäbä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer lä-Muse wä-yǝbelo, “And God spoke unto Moses and said to him”, (e.g., fols. 53rc, 58rab, 70rabc); elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals. Rubrication is not executed on fols. 14vb-18rb, 29rb-35ra, 150ra-159rc.

additional.cont: Fol. 191vab: Record concerning litigation over land holding.
additional.det: The note, dated to 1923 year of mercy (=1930/31 A.D.), contains names of the judge, parties involved in the trial, witnesses and guarantors as well as the matter in dispute and the verdict. It is written in Amharic, by a well-trained hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 192r-193v: Land grant issued by King Mənilək II for ras Mängäša Yoḥannəs’ children.
additional.det: The text runs as follows: 193r, 193v, 192r. The document, dated to 1889 years of mercy, gives a list of lands in various parts of Tǝgray (32 places) which King Mǝnilǝk II donated as gwǝlt and rǝst to ras Mängäša Yoḥannǝs’ two children after the battle of ʾAdwa (1896). In the beginning, it mentions the invasion of Italians and their defeat at ʿAdwa. It is written in Amharic, in a well-trained hand. There is a stamp of King Mǝnilǝk II on fol. 193r.

additional.cont: Fol. 194rv: Record concerning reconciliation.
additional.det: The note mentions involved parties and guarantors. It is written in Amharic, in a well-trained hand.

extras.extra: - Title of the Ms. is written on the front cover. - Internal number of the monastic library, 384, is written on fol. 1r. - Gǝʿǝz and Amharic glosses are written in the margins of fol. 2rv. The glossed words are marked with small signs ├ ┤ (the horizontal dash points towards the margin) written above them. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margins, belongs on fol. 80ra l.29.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: -Threads are inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 65v, 120v (red), 150v, 168v, 188v (green), for navigation in the text. They mark the end of one book and beginning of the next one.
